rComments: Great all around professor. His material is straight forward and his teaching style makes it easy to understand everything. Super understanding and wants his students to do well.

Extremely helpful and organized professor! You can see his passion for what he teaches and wants to see his students succeed. His lectures, slides, and quizzes are all very helpful. His tests are not easy but he allows students to make corrections. You will definitely walk out remembering a lot of his material. Highly recommend him!
His lectures area awesome, I learned a lot without reading the book. Show up to class take good notes pay attention and you'll get an A.

Hoffman is an excellent professor. It was really fun taking peace psych with him. Even though we had to do a paper and presentation, he made himself available every step of the way. It wasn't as daunting as you would think. His passion for psych always shines through. Paper, pres, and two quizzes. He's a very fair grader if you put legit effort in

uses ecommons for everything. he is great and it is obvious he is passionate about what he teaches. you can also see that he wants to help you pass the course. it is point-based! great class! interesting! a lot of work, but truly manageable! i would and most like will take him again, i want to!

Tony is a awesome. I took psych 170 during summer session and was initially worried that the amount of information we would be covering would be too much for 5 weeks, but it wasn't. Overall a great professor. Follow his directions and you'll get an A. He actually let us re-take our tests up to 3 times each week, this guy really cares!

You do not have to go to class but he does take attendance randomly. You will get an A if you memorize all of the words on his study guides. The book was only useful for looking up the definitions. This is not hard class all you have to do is study the words.

He is a really good teacher, his tests are reasonalble as well as his grading. 4 easy t/f  multiple ? tests, final, and short paper. has alot of passion for what he does and makes the class interesting. He is the kind of person who will take the time to help you with anything and is understanding of any circumstance. I recomend!!

Tony doesn't listen to students, and pokes fun when comments are made. He works in ways to tell the class about his humanitarianism--even if it has nothing to do with what he is teaching ( I took adolescent development but he worked in how selfless he is around the world ). His study guides are unreasonably long for how his tests are structured.

Tony is a fantastic professor. He's super passionate and while his main love lies in children and war, he is beyond capable in all other classes he teaches. As long as you do your work (do googledocs for the study guides) you will do well.

This class is Tony's baby. He loves to teach it, definitely relatable. there are 2 group projects that take some time, but are definitely worth learning about, cares about his students. His study guides are stressful, but tests are fair. if you study hard you'll easily get an A. Write as much as you can on tests and don't leave anything blank.

Tony is a great teacher. He is really passionate about his field and loves to get to know his students. His study guides are very long and stressful but his tests are very fair, and if you study hard you will get an A.

Tony is amazing! His clases are really interesting and you can tell he loves the subject in all that he teaches. Join a google doc for the tests, memorize everything, and you will get an A. Just be willing to memorize a lot. Also, there are film summaries you have to do, but most the films can be found online.
Tony is an amazing professor, the best I've had at UCSC. He is passionate and has the funniest humor. GO Tony!

He gives a lot of work but it is an easy class to pass if you put effort into it. His exam are very easy... basic on memorizing key terms and essay prompts. Very passion about what he teaches. I would take another class from him

He never came off as rude to me, he always answered questions in class without talking down. I think others are just misinterpreting is oddity, which isn't a bad thing. The lectures were (almost) always interesting. However, he curves DOWN, as in a 91% is a B! Lots of extra credit, but it just adds to an already time-consuming class.

the class is interesting and I believe that the topic is important, but I couldn't stand him. Basically, I have the same feelings as the person below. The class is not bad if you can learn to tolerate him...

I'm torn when it comes to Tony (or David?). He was very knowledgeable about the material and is doing a very noble thing with the Children and War class. At the same time, he was a bit of a jerk (I would use a different word, but RMP would delete this entry). He was condescending and would talk down to students. Kind of an ass....sorry but he was.

Tony is one amazing guy. The fact that he's a psychology professor and a wonderful one at that, just astounds me. He is so dedicated to children and peace psychology that his classes are truly eye-opening and engaging.

Tony is great, he is extremely passionate for what he teaches. His lectures are very interesting, I always looked forward to them. He is very helpful and easy to contact with questions. His quizes are actually exams, and they are challenging, use the study guide. 'Children and War' has opened my eyes to the crisis happening around the world.

Tony is a great professor. His tests use a good balance of lecture and reading, so you should know at least a little about both. He's hard of hearing, so if you don't speak up, he can't answer your questions! It's a difficult class, but well worth it, and the only class of it's type taught to undergraduates in this country. I recommed it!

This had to have been the most boring class ever! As long as you MEMORIZE the LONG study guide you'll do great! I got an A in the course and never showed up to class. If you heard the first lecture, you heard them all! Tony was RUDE, and made you feel bad for asking questions that you needed clarified. IRONY: hes unsympathetic to his own students!!
I hated this class. Wonderful subject. Complete ass of a professor.

David or, he goes by, Tony (why is that?) has absolutely no clue on the amount of work he gives his students. He thinks everyones life should revolve around saving children and that's simply not the case. His, hmph, quizes are extremely difficult and require many many hours of studying. Plus the TA was awful too (at least this quater). Stay Away.

Don't take a class from him unless you want to hate your life for the next 4 monthes. His "quizes" were ridiculously hard, he constantly interrupted people after calling on them to speak, and was completely rude. The worst part was that he had no idea his social skills were so aggravating to put up with. He does however do good things in the world.

I thought the class was really hard, but Tony was absolutely fantastic. He made every bit of angst completely worth it. He brings in awesome stories and examples of things and you end up learning a lot. The quizzes are really really hard but I guess if you study the study guide really well in groups it ends up okay. It's just a lot of studying...

Abnormal psych should be an exciting course; however, Santa Cruz appears to lack a good teacher for this course.  Don't go to class... do the study guide in groups (this is necessary due to the length)...memorize it. Memorize it.  Seriously that is all you need to do to get an A+.  Come to class if you want but bring something to entertain yourself
I thought this was one of the best classes I have ever taken...the study guides are long & involve, but test material is pulled directly from them & if you study you will get an A!
he gives LONG study guides, but if u study them...u get an A

He is a boring professor. I still don't have an eval from 7 months ago. He repeats what he says over and over and is unorganized. He does have extra credit if you do badly on his "quizes." He has a study guide for the "quizes" but they are really midterms and they are long and hard. Do the study gui

He is pretty boring. He lectures with power point but refuses to let people copy what is displayed, saying it is online for you.The notes online are not complete or there at all. His quizes are difficult. He gives a study guide but it isn't that helpful.

Lectures are decently interesting. Tests 4 non cumu. are easy if you've done the reading. Prof. allows for 2 optional papers to help grade. at first I wasn't sure about him because he wears lame ties to be funny, but his teaching ability changed my mind.

Prof. Hoffman is probably one of the most boring lecturers I've ever stumbled upon.He stands there repeating the same thing ad nauseum, every now and then contributing with his dry, awkward and often questionable humor.Quizzes are unecessarily difficult.
